ygData.subject: Re: neglected melee skills..
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: TkAdam@aol.com  To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com  Date: Thursday, May 13, 1999 7:17 AM Subject: Re:
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: TkAdam@... <TkAdam@...>
To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, May 13, 1999 7:17 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] neglected melee skills..


Not sure if this was stated or not but the reason it is this way with things
you put a point in is if you acquire a skill and have 0 and put 1 point in
it it will give you your current level of points. example: level 8 wizard
puts one point into conjuration he would then have a 8 conjuration skill.

>From: TkAdam@...
>
>In a message dated 5/13/99 3:35:08 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
>kalekona@... writes:
>
>> Necromancers get thier first evocation spell at level 8.
>> (Ward Undead)
>> They see thier first skill increase. "You have become better
>> at evocation (1)."
>>
>> They do not have to wait till the skill gets to 9 before
>> seeing it. That just means that people just miss seeing the
>> first 8 messages. (Maybe you all have EVERY hit and miss
>> showing up on your message window and it is flying by. I
>> personally turn the others hits and misses off so that I
>> don't get bothered by the messages.)
>
>I have found it depends on the skill... and often depends if it is a brand
>new skill or not.
>
>if I have a skill where "you have learned the basics" comes up... I will
see
>NOTHING until it advances to my level.
>
>An example... I have seen this as a cleric and a pure caster. With
>meditate... watching VERY closely for it... as I mage I see nothing until
it
>I see "you have learned meditate (5)" as a Cleric I see nothing until "you
>have learned meditate (9)" or whatever the phrasing is. I DON'T see
>anything until it passes the level I got the skill at.
>
>as a Fighter I have seen this for skills such as bash... No messages until
I
>get it to 10. (fighters get bash at 9)
>
>now all casters have the "basics" at all casting skills at 0'th level :)
(or
>at the start) so you see the first one.
>
>Sonoroud
>
